name: Ivan V. BajiÄ‡
title: Professor, School of Engineering Science
bio: I am a Professor of Engineering Science at Simon Fraser University. My professional interests revolve around signal processing, machine learning, and their applications in image and video processing, coding, communications, and multimedia ergonomics. In addition to research, teaching, and consulting in these areas, I was also involved in new media art as a Telepresence Architect for several telematic dance/music performances in 2009-2010.
research1: Signal, image, and video processing and compression

name: Jie Liang
title: Professor, School of Engineering Science
bio: Jie Liang received the B.E. and M.E. degrees from Xi'an Jiaotong University, China, the M.E. degree from National University of Singapore (NUS), and the PhD degree from the Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, Maryland, USA, in 1992, 1995, 1998, and 2003, respectively. Since May 2004, he has been with the School of Engineering Science, Simon Fraser University, Canada, where he is currently a Professor. He served as the Associate Director of the School in 2015-2018. In 2012, he visited University of Erlangen-Nuremberg, Germany, as an Alexander von Humboldt Research Fellow. From 2003 to 2004, he worked at the Video Codec Group of Microsoft Digital Media Division. From 1997 to 1999, he was with Hewlett-Packard Singapore and the Center for Wireless Communications (now part of the Institute for Infocomm Research), NUS.

name: Atousa Hajshirmohammadi
title: University Lecturer, School of Engineering Science
bio: I received my B.Sc. and M.Sc. from Isfahan University of Technology in Electrical and Computer Engineering and my Ph.D. from University of Waterloo in Communications Engineering. Since 2004, I have been a Lecturer and Senior Lecturer at the School of Engineering Science at SFU. Prior to that, I worked as a Senior Design Engineer at LSI Logic Inc, in Milpitas, California. I have taught several courses in a wide range of subjects including electrical circuits, logic circuits, communications, signal processing, control systems, and coding. I have also taught some of the largest classes in ENSC. The list of the courses I am currently teaching or have previously taught can be found by clicking on the Teaching link given further down.
research1: Wireless and digital communications at coding and modulation level
